Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Cell::Cell (  short unsigned int  P = 0,
state  S = undecided
)  [inline]
 

Cell Constructor.

Initilize a cell setting its state (undecided by default) and initial possibility

  • P initial cell possibility. optional argument, set to 0 (which means unset) by default. If it's 0, all the range [1,9] will be added automatically the posibilities list
  • S initial state. optional argument, set to undecided by default

Member Function Documentation

void Cell::addPossibility (  short unsigned int  myP  )  throw (domain_error)
 

Adds a given possibility to the list.

Adds the given value to the possibilities list if it's not there already.

  • myP the value to add
    Exceptions:
    domain_error Thrown if myP is not within the range [1,9]

Definition at line 121 of file sudoku.cpp.

void Cell::check (  short unsigned int  myP  )  throw (domain_error) [static, private]
 

Checks validity of a given posiblity.

Given possibility must be between 1 and 9.

  • myP Value to check
    Exceptions:
    domain_error Thrown if an argument not within the range [1,9] is provided

Definition at line 43 of file sudoku.cpp.

Referenced by sudoku::Line::delPossibility(), sudoku::Box::delPossibility(), sudoku::Line::isPossible(), sudoku::Box::isPossible(), and isPossible().

void Cell::delPossibility (  short unsigned int  myP  )  throw (logic_error)
 

Removes a given value from the possibilities list.

Removes the given value to the possibilities list if it's in there. If a given value is not within [1,9], we won't even try to delete it.

  • myP the value to remove
    Exceptions:
    logic_error Thrown if no possibility is left, all of them were deleted

Definition at line 176 of file sudoku.cpp.

void Cell::fastDelPossibility (  short unsigned int  myP  )  throw (logic_error) [private]
 

Removes a given value from the possibilities list without checking the given value validity.

Removes the given value to the possibilities list if it's in there. If after performing the elimination there's only one possibility left, State is automatically set to definitive.

  • myP the value to remove
    Exceptions:
    logic_error Thrown if cell state is undecided instead of definitive

Definition at line 56 of file sudoku.cpp.

bool Cell::fastIsPossible (  short unsigned int  myP  )  const [private]
 

Returns wether a given value is possible or not without checking the given value validity.

  • myP the value to test
    Returns:
    true if the given value is in the posibilities list, or false if not.

short unsigned int Cell::get (   )  throw (logic_error) [inline]
 

Gets the definitive value of the cell.

This can only be done if the cell state is definitive.
